intro: Pedicularis moesiaca, commonly known as the Moesian lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its parasitic nature, relying on host plants for nutrients. The plant produces striking, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often resembling the shape of a louse, hence its common name. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
